name: 陳柔妃
objective: Geological hazard is one of the main types of natural disasters, and historically it has brought endless pain to humans, leaving many painful memories, so it is the environmental issues that are of the most concern to people. This class is highly recommended for the following reasons: (1) understandable explanations of complex geologic processes are provided in clear diagrams, (2)world-wide examples are used, (3) modern interdisciplinary approaches are emphasized, (4) a robust bibliography is provided.
schedule:
Week 1. Introduction
Week 2. Landslide 
Week 3. Slope failure form characteristics
Week 4. Assessment of slopes
Week 5. Treatment of slopes
Week 6. Investigation of slopes
Week 7. Groundwater and Oil extraction
Week 8. Midterm examination
Week 9 Week Subsurface mining 
Week 10. Solution of Rock
Week 11. Soil subsidence and collapse 
Week 12. Heave in soil and rock
Week 13. Earthquakes Elements 
Week 14. Surface effects on the geologic environment
Week 15. Earthquake resistant design
Week 16. Investigation: Important structure in high-hazard areas
Week 17. The earth and geologic History
Week 18. End-term examination
materials:
Geologic Hazards: A Field Guide for Geotechnical Engineers 1st Roy E. Hunt 2019
Geologic Hazards: A Sourcebook Timothy Kusky 2003
Getting to Know ArcGIS Pro 2.6 Michael Law and Amy collins 2020
